title.narrative: Integrated Services for Infrastructure and Sanitation Technology (INSIST) II

description.narrative:
Goal: To develop an affordable, sustainable, and context appropriate waste management system in poverty affected high-density communities of Jakarta
Objectives: 1- Refined, newly developed sanitation technologies are user friendly, context appropriate and can be sold at affordable price points 2- Demand and access to affordable sanitation services is increased in one poverty affected Kelurahan of North Jakarta 3- A sustainable and vibrant market for affordable sanitation services is developed by facilitating the role of stakeholders (market, government and community actors) to enable sanitation solutions for the urban and peri-urban poor in Jakarta

Indonesia's rapidly urbanizing population, along with an existing lack of sanitation and water services for many, mean that there is a need for enhanced infrastructure which supports the health and hygiene of the urban poor. INSIST II will build on the research of INSIST, RW Siaga Plus+ and PUSH to provide market-based sustainable solutions for households in the Kelurahan (Village) Penjaringan, in Kecamatan (Sub-District) Penjaringan in North Jakarta.
In particular, activities will include a market research and feasibility study to determine the sanitation and fiscal needs of households in the target area; the development of a sanitation value chain analysis and report to highlight key stakeholders and market constraints which will determine design interventions; the development and refinement of a Sanitation Management Plan in partnership with the Department of Public Works and other government administrations; Identifying of community stakeholders and establishing a community Sanitation Task Force to manage sanitation systems implementation; Construction of household and communal septic tanks as well as sludge removal carts and storage facilities; Developing a community fecal removal model; Creating a social marketing campaign with key players to facilitate behavior change and knowledge dissemination around sanitation products; partnering with local SMEs to install and operate sanitation products; and working with local MFIs to create sanitation related financial services for households.
This will improve the access of urban poor households to sanitation products and facilitate a market for low-cost, sustainable sanitation solutions which will be replicable in other areas. INSIST II will also instill partnerships between community stakeholders, government actors, and private sector players to ensure buy-in.
